channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: FTC data confirms job offer text scams are 4 times more common now and have cost job seekers almost $300 million
item.description: Text scams have grown especially quickly in the last five years, with 20,673 reports last year compared with just 4,872 reports in 2020.

item.title: Indiana Homeowner Charged in Shooting of Cleaning Woman Who Arrived at Wrong House
item.description: A man was charged with manslaughter after a woman was shot through the front door of a home before dawn this month in suburban Indianapolis.

item.title: ‘In 2030, he’s not going to be the president’: Even Republicans are warning of Trump’s lame duck status as affordability, Epstein threaten to derail tenure
item.description: "You will have voted to protect pedophiles if you don’t vote to release these files, and the president can’t protect you then," Rep. Thomas Massie tol...

item.title: Zohran Mamdani hopeful of meeting with Donald Trump soon to talk about affordability
item.description: “The president ran a campaign where he spoke about a promise to deliver cheaper groceries, a promise to reduce the cost of living," the mayor-elect sa...

item.title: Companies need to take a human-centric approach to AI, experts say, as executives try to shift from experimentation to implementation
item.description: “For every dollar that we spend on technology, we should spend three more on people," said Gastón Carrión, Accenture's APAC lead of talent.

item.title: This Cisco exec started at the $306 billion company 30 years ago after interviewing for the wrong gig. It inspired her to fight for entry-level jobs
item.description: Fran Katsoudas, Cisco’s chief people, policy, and purpose officer, started her three-decade career at the digital communications giant after experienc...

item.title: David Richardson, Acting FEMA Administration, Resigns
item.description: David Richardson had been on the job for six months. FEMA employees had questioned his ability to lead the agency.

item.title: Judge Says Justice Dept. May Have Committed Misconduct in Comey Case
item.description: The magistrate judge raised the question of whether “government misconduct” in the case might require dismissing the charges against the former F.B.I....

item.title: Why Britain Is Embracing ‘Negative Nation Branding’
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer, trying to get a grip on a feverish immigration debate, is introducing a hard-line, contentious policy on refugees.

item.title: Here’s What Trump Should Actually Do for Fertility
item.description: Trump’s policies on in vitro fertilization are underwhelming but his announcement still made me optimistic.

item.title: 2 Charged in Over 300 Thefts at Mausoleums in Toronto Area
item.description: The thefts took place during the daytime when the pair would enter mausoleums to swipe necklaces and other jewelry from remains, the authorities said.

item.title: 25 Girls Abducted From School in Nigeria
item.description: The kidnapping echoed the abduction of the Chibok girls 11 years ago and came as U.S. officials pressed the country to address violence against Christ...

item.title: Trump and the ‘Donroe Doctrine’
item.description: The president is claiming a special U.S. sphere of influence in the Western Hemisphere.

item.title: Trump Project in Maldives Opens More Doors for Cryptocurrency Investors
item.description: The Trump Organization and its Middle East development partner have announced a project in the Maldives that marries two of the family’s most successf...

item.title: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Is Sentenced to Death
item.description: Sheikh Hasina, who is living in exile in India, was convicted in absentia of crimes against humanity during a brutal crackdown on student-led protests...
